newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks close sharply higher on export hopes.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks close sharply higher on export hopes.

text.p: South Korean stocks closed sharply higher on Wednesday as broad optimism about an economic recovery kept sentiment buoyant, brokers said.
The optimism, renewed on Tuesday by brisk June trade balance figures, has combined with ample liquidity resulting from the slowdown in capital investments by companies, they said.
Analysts saw the market rising another 15-20 percent this year, particularly since the foreign ownership ceiling is due to be expanded for the second time this year in the second half.
On Wednesday, the composite index closed up 2.54 percent, or 19.26 points, to 777.29.
In June, South Korea recorded the first monthly trade surplus in 30 months of $97.6 million, against a $426 million deficit a year earlier.
Provisional trade ministry figures showed exports rose 9.2 percent year-on-year in June for the third consecutive month, while exports increased by 4.4 percent.

"The economy now appears to have passed the worst point and the liquidity remains ample. These and other technical factors are expected to keep the market bullish for a while," said Shim Choong-bo, research manager at Daishin Securities.
Heavily export-reliant sectors and securities firms led gains on Wednesday.
Shipping firms rose on hopes that their earnings would increase in line with the recovery in exports. The sector's sub-index closed up 5.92 percent to 565.56.
Shares of securities firms gained as investors believed the falling interest rates and the stock market's rally would boost earnings of brokerage firms.
Ssangyong Motor closed up 410 won at its daily limit of 5,540 won on news that its main creditor bank approved the company's application for a 20 billion won loan.
Chohung Bank said it had supplied another 20 billion won to the debt-ridden vehicle maker by purchasing commercial papers issued by Ssangyong.
September index futures gained 1.70 points to 84.10 and the underlying KOSPI-200 index rose 2.35 points to 81.63.
